choices.A: Contact the application vendor support staff for more information
choices.C: Boot the PC, run msconfig, check the safe boot box under the Boot tab, and then restart
choices.B: Boot into safe mode, and then load the ERD and restore the most recent files
choices.D: Log in as an administrative user and determine if the problem persists

questions.question_text: A user installed a new company-approved application on a Windows PC. The installation required a reboot. After the reboot and logon, the system froze. A technician has been called to fix the problem. Which of the following should the technician do FIRST?

discussion.content: D is by far the least intrusive to check and could tell you a lot. For example - the system freeze occurs after the user logs in. As others have said it could be a one time thing. Or it could be something is trying to run that needs administrator rights to run, and that is preventing the system getting any further. Either of these problems would be quickly diagnosed with logging in as the admin and then, if successful, trying again as the user to see if the freeze still occurs. After that you could try booting into safe mode if you still haven't fixed the problem.

emergency repair disk (ERD) Saves critical boot files and partition
information and is the main tool for fixing boot problems in older versions of
Windows. Newer versions of Windows call this a system repair disc
(Windows 7) or recovery drive (Windows 8/8.1 and 10).

comments.content: agreed, you want to see if the problem persists before you restore the most recent files. what if it was a one time thing?

discussion.content: In a domain-based environment where user permissions can play havoc on app installs and usability, I'd check functionality with an admin user before altering anything.

comments.content: B would come after. I can see where they are coming from. It's kinda in the same concept as if I had download a application and soon as I did stuff on it. I got errors on everything.. but then I ask a coworker to download the same app on his user profile, same pc.. and it works.. but still doesn't work on yours.. that would give signs of a corrupted user profile. If the another user profile tried the application and it works.. in this case a admin .. then the issue is pointing to the user profile and not the application. Hence why B is not the answer. It could be though later on

discussion.content: I'm with you - why not B??
Doens't work anymore in the real world, ifconfig is not installed per default, the new command is: ip a

comments.content: The exam itself is stated to be due for an update in July of this year, so hopefully the EoL for Windows 7 and Vista will be addressed in the new version.
Yeah the test is a bit dated. There's a bunch of windows 7 questions when 7 is basically end of life.

Just to point out it doesn't say what distro is being used. A lot of distros do still have ifconfig installed, or if they don't they just alias ifconfig to ip -a the same way very few distros still have vi installed but the command still works because it's just aliased to vim

discussion.content: ifconfig is the only correct choice available

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a network connectivity issue on a Linux workstation. Which of the following commands would help the technician gain information about the network settings on the machine?

discussion.content: troubleshooting before action would be first... answer D is correct...

Selected Answer: D
answer is D her PC must be in the same network with switch connected to the server, and PC IP address must be on the vlan network to make FTP work.

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C

questions.question_text: Ann, a network engineer, wants to use FTP to back up and push configurations to several switches she is updating. Ann starts the FTP service on her PC and places the new configuration in the correct directory. However, she cannot communicate with the PC using FTP from the switch. Which of the following must Ann do to allow FTP communications?

choices.C: Create a new exception on her local firewall
choices.B: Change her NIC IP address to dynamic
choices.A: Create a static DNS entry on the server for the PC
choices.D: Make sure the PC's IP is in the management VLAN

discussion.content:
A. ping: This is like shouting out to see if a friend can hear you. If they shout back, you know they’re there and you can reach them. If they don’t, they might be too far away, or something might be blocking your voice.
B. nslookup: This is like looking up a friend’s house in a neighborhood directory. It tells you where their house is located.
C. net use: This is like creating a secret path directly to your friend’s hiding spot. Once the path is set up, you can use it to send messages back and forth easily.
D. ipconfig: This is like looking at a map of your neighborhood. It shows you where you are, and gives information about the paths leading to your friends’ houses. So in this case I believe it to be PING
Shouldn't you use ping FIRST to see if you can communicate with the server? What good is net use if you can't reach the \\servername

comments.content: Net command does specifically net view allows you to see available shared resources, not net use, you would attempt to connect to a share using net use. I feel like ping is what you need to do FIRST to see if the connection to the server is even possible.

discussion.content: net use   This subcommand of the Windows net command enables a user to connect, disconnect, and view information about existing connections to network resources.
Has a technician earning 200 dollars a month I agree with this

questions.question_text:
A user is unable to access a network share but can access email. A technician has confirmed the user has the appropriate permissions to access the share.
Which of the following commands should the technician use FIRST?

A user is unable to print to the office's networked laser printer from a Windows desktop. A technician attempts to print a test page, but nothing comes out of the printer. The technician tries to print from a label printer, which is connected via USB, but there is no output from that printer either. Which of the following actions are MOST likely to restore printing functionality to both printers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
1. Check to make sure the printer is turned on and connected to the same Wi-Fi network as your device. 
2. Run a printer power cycle and check cables 
3. Set your printer as the default printer. 
4. Check and Clear the print queue. 
5. Reset the service that manages the printing queue. 
6. Remove and re-add your printer to your device. 7. Restart your PC.
C and F to me

comments.content: D & F are right in CompTia world, don't follow these steps

discussion.content: So he dont care about label printer ? Need good explanation why he left that.

comments.content: Neither printer can be printed to. Restarting the Print Spooler and power cycling the computer would help with both printers in the same way.
D & F are already the correct one.
no the correct answer is CDEF, if your going to restart the desktop why not restart the printer too in that way everything boots up fresh right. You are just one button away.

discussion.content: the correct answers are C & F
